intro: Ctenopteris albidula, commonly known as the white-veined sea蒲, is a species of fern belonging to the family Blechnaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, pinnately divided fronds with white veins that contrast with its dark green foliage. Native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, this plant thrives in moist, shaded environments. The fronds are typically short and compact, forming a dense, low-growing structure. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its unique and elegant appearance.
